title: What is the consequence of having a tech that is capable of producing early manual repeating rifles (technology, technological development, firearms, worldbuilding)? - Quora

response.answer_text: The technology that came with being able to produce early repeating rifles came with the Industrial Revolution. A locomotive built buy workers in a factory with parts that could be replaced was far more efficient than having a skilled craftsman build a locomotive from scratch with parts he made himself. Going from having craftsmen produce hand fitted firearms (or other products like shoes) to having workers on an assembly line using machines and later having interchangeable parts was, well, revolutionary.
We have already seen the consequences. We don’t have to guess. Manual repeating rifles have been around since the Civil War.
